result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on May 17, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant in custody.   
State moves to dismiss and read in this case file, the defendant entered pleas in 16 CF 40, 16 CF 57 and 16 CF 65.   Motion granted.   
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a plea date on 04-05-17 at 8:30 a.m.
Copy filed.
Plea date on April 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 27, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
All records scanned and verified.
Jury trial on April 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status Conference set for 10-06-2016 at 4:00 p.m., Br. 2.
Status conference set for 08-22-16 at 3:45 p.m.
Status conference on July 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on June 10, 2016 at 09:15 am.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit 
Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 04-08-16 at 2:30 p.m.
Minutes.
Matthew Goldin, through Public Defender.
Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Withdrawing Counsel, Atty. Heather Richmond, through Public Defender.

Attorney Heather Richmond appointed by State PD office failed to appear for Preliminary Hearing today.
Defendant requests new appointment and waives time limits.
Court orders withdrawal of counsel and new appointment.
Preliminary Hearing is reset  to 03-07-2016 @ 2:30 p.m.
Minutes

ADDRESS INFO for Russel S. SLIWINSKI
Current: 3009 Lincoln Ave  #6, c/o Cool City Motel, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 02-15-2016)
Prior: 851 N. 18th Street #a, Manitowoc, WI 54220

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  $1,500.00 recognizance bond previously furnished is continued by the Court with the same conditions.  Preliminary Hearing set for 02-24-2016 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 2.  (Notice given to defendant.)
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

State request warrant. Court authorizes warrant.
Minutes
Heather Richmond, Public Defender.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 02-10-16 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 01-16-16.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of disorderly conduct and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-01-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Karen Leifer, except for purposes of paying rent and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail  furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
